intro: Tephrosia sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered tephrosia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It features small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to white in color. The plant has compound leaves with multiple leaflets and is often found in dry, open habitats. It is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Tephrosia sparsiflora is also valued for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of bioactive compounds.
